Hello

My name is Alena

Different people have different hobbies: someone makes vlogs for Instagram, others bake cakes worthy of participating in the GBBO, and others grow a collection of cacti. But if you ask about my hobby, I will tell you my passion is to study.

I believe that the learning process does not end when a person receives a diploma at the graduation ceremony, it continues throughout one's life. Some knowledge and skills need to be constantly updated because we live in a rapidly changing world. Some people have to change jobs in midlife due to layoffs, unforeseen pandemics, burnout, or moving to another country where your skills become irrelevant, as it was in my case.

About me

I believe that online education platforms offer a great opportunity to try a new profession from the comfort of your home. I get acquainted with popular online-learning platforms like Coursera and EDX, I learned online how to write articles and improved my language skills. But nothing gives me as much pleasure as learning programming. Despite the fact that this is the most difficult thing that I have done in my life, it is also the most rewarding. Programming allows me instantly see the result of my actions and feel Eureka Moment every time I try to solve a puzzle.

Over the years of self-education, I realized what kind of learning style is right for me - I work well individually and in a team, and memorize information best of all thanks to the spaced repetition and its immediate application in practice. Same approach is used by the language learning app Duolingo. I also believe that a similar approach can be implemented when learning a programming language. I think that my past learning experience will help me successfully complete the CodeYourFuture course.

New Technology

I believe that new technologies inevitably penetrate all areas of life and then become an integral part of life. For example, Zoom, Slack, GoogleDocs, and many more allowed people living in different parts of the world to collaborate as if they were sitting in the same office. All of this has become possible thanks to software developers who create these products disrupting the market.

However, not only does younger generations benefit from new tech: some traditional industries such as agriculture uses new technologies to their advantage: by processing large amounts of weather and crop data, it is possible to make a fairly accurate forecast for the upcoming season and measures needed to improve yield.

The humorous video, which can be found on the right, tells how in the near future any ordinary farmer will be forced to get to know more about robots and computer technology.

Thinking about the future, I understand that I want to be one of those who change the world for the better - to be part of a company that develops products and technologies that, possibly, will disrupt the market or simply make people's everyday life better.
